title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 645-4.11 - Final determination and order
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 645-4.11 - Final determination and order

State Regulations
(a) After receipt of the hearing officer's
report, the commission shall make a final determination based upon the
record. (b) The final determination
shall be embodied in a final order which shall contain findings of fact and
conclusions of law or reasons for the final determination, and which may
provide for: (1)
the dismissal of
charges; (2)
an assessment of
penalties consistent with applicable provisions of the ECL, articles 43 and 71, title 33; (3)
a direction for
abatement; (4)
a combination of any
or all of the foregoing; or
(5)
any
determination deemed appropriate under the circumstances, consistent with
applicable provisions of the ECL, articles 43 and 71, title 33, or the rules
and regulations promulgated thereunder, or any permits, certificates or orders
issued by the commission. (c) A copy of the final determination and
order shall be served on the parties in the same manner as is provided by
section
645-4.2
(c) of this Subpart for the service of a notice of hearing and complaint or
UAC. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
645-4.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
